did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 21.75 linear feet (41 boxes and 8 oversize folders)

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Recorded Sound Reference Center, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division Library of Congress

did.abstract: Press releases, record catalogs, radio program scripts, promotional posters, monthly publications about new record releases, and other materials advertising sound recordings.
did.physloc: RPA 00353-00393 (boxes 1-41); RPC 00013 (box OSC 1); RPE 00003 (box OSE 1); RPM 00011 (map case)

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers.
Radio Corporation of America. RCA Victor Division.

acqinfo.head: Collection Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was transferred from the Library of Congress Music Division to the Recorded Sound Section at an unspecified time.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Record Industry Publicity Collection is formed of promotional materials that were mailed from record label publicity departments to the Library of Congress Music Division during 1940s through the 1970s. The Music Division later transferred the materials to the Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, where it was processed as a collection.

accruals.head: Additions
accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Maya Lerman and David Jackson, with assistance from Marsha Maguire, in 2010.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Restrictions may exist on copying, quoting, or publishing materials included in the collection. For additional information, contact a reference librarian in the Recorded Sound Reference Center, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707-7833.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Record Industry Publicity Collection is open for research. Advance notice is required; contact a reference librarian in the Recorded Sound Reference Center, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707- 7833.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [Container number, eg., Box 3], Record Industry Publicity Collection, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes press releases, disc catalogs, scripts from radio programs, monthly publications about new record releases, and promotional posters. The materials were originally created to promote recordings issued by labels such as Capitol, Columbia, Decca, and RCA Victor; broadcasters such as NBC; and performance rights organizations such as ASCAP and BMI.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in 14 series:

list.item: Series 1: ASCAP (American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers)
Series 14: Concert and Festival Programs and Announcements

did.unittitle: Series 1. ASCAP (American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers) Radio Program Service, 1942

scopecontent.p: The series consists of scripts from ASCAP's Radio Program Service. Programs represented are "Music Just for You," "Music...As You Like It," and "You Shall Have Music."

Publicity material for Broadcast Music, Inc., including individual series publications entitled Bulletin and Concert Music. Concert Music includes Concert Pin-up Sheet, Today in Music, and Your Concert Hall. Also includes script sheets for the BMI-sponsored radio shows Inside Story, Milestones, Spotlight on a Star, and According to the Record.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to publication type, starting with publicity material and followed by scripts for radio series. Arranged chronologically within each publication.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous published memos and newsletters, 1952, 1954, and undated

note.p: Material includes It's Touchdown Time, BMI Music Memo, BMI Newsletter, and Vital Changes.

unittitle.title: BMI Presents According to the Record

scopecontent.p: The series includes publicity material for Capitol Records, including individual series publications entitled From Capitol Records Information Bureau, Classical Programming Service, and Platter Patter from the Corner of Sunset and Vine. Further includes a numbered series of cards featuring new releases (which are listed below as New Capitol Records pamphlets and Capitol new releases cards), as well as a series of indexed Reviewer's Reference Cards (which are numbered by release) and ephemera.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to publication type, starting with publicity material and followed by new release cards and pamphlets. Arranged chronologically within each publication.

did.unittitle: Platter Patter from the Corner of Sunset and Vine, 1950
Latest Additions to Capitol's Catalog, 1949, and undated
Miscellaneous press releases and publicity, 1945-1953, and undated

scopecontent.p: Series 4 includes publicity material and press department releases for Columbia Records, including individual series publications entitled News about Columbia Records, Speaking of Records, Columbia Records Biographical Service, Columbia LP Masterworks News, and News about Columbia Popular Records. The series also contains monthly supplements to the Columbia Numerical Catalog.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to publication type, starting with publicity material and followed by the numerical catalog. Arranged chronologically within each publication.

did.unittitle: News of the Stars on Columbia Masterworks Records, 1947
Columbia Records Children's News, 1952, 1955, and undated
News of the Stars on Columbia Records, 1946-1947
5th Anniversary Special LP News from Columbia Records, Inc., 1953
The Philadelphia Orchestra, "The World's Greatest Orchestra," 1945/1955, 10th Anniversary on Columbia Records, 1955

note.p: Each folder represents a monthly installment from May through August.
Each folder represents a monthly installment from June through December.

scopecontent.p: Each folder represents a monthly installment including January, June through September, and October through December.

note.p: Each folder represents a monthly installment from January through April, and August through December.
Each folder represents a monthly installment for the entire year.
Each folder represents a monthly installment from January through June.

scopecontent.p: Series 5 contains press releases, including individual titles such as Disk Data, New Releases, and News from MGM Records.
Series includes publicity material, including individual titles such as Music News from NBC, NBC Music Round-up, and University of the Air.

did.unittitle: Information...from NBC Public Affairs and Education, 1950

scopecontent.p: The series consists of promotional correspondence and various catalogs, including individually entitled series such as Grapevine, Peters International Illustrated Catalog, and New Releases.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to publication type, starting with promotional correspondence and followed by catalogs. Arranged chronologically within each publication.

did.unittitle: Catalogs of recordings grouped by country or region, undated

note.p: Separate catalogs for African, East Indies, Indian, Latin American, and Middle Eastern recordings. In addition, there is one catalog from the Philips/Fontana group of world music labels arranged alphabetically by country.
Includes Imported French and Imported German catalogs.
Includes Indian, Israeli, Italian, and Mid-East catalogs.

unittitle.title: Records & Tapes from around the World

scopecontent.p: Series 8 includes a numbered series of cards featuring new releases for Decca Records and subsidiary labels, such as Commodore and the British Decca company, numbered by release; also includes press releases such as the individually titled series From Decca Records; further includes a series of pamphlets containing notes for album sets issued by Decca; press releases for Decca Distributing Corporation; and ephemera, including advertisements and catalogs.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to publication type, starting with new release cards and pamphlets, followed by press releases and catalogs. Arranged chronologically within each publication.

did.unittitle: Full Frequency Range Records Imported from England, 1947-1948, and undated
Commodore Records (released through Decca distributing corporation), 1947
Assorted record player equipment advertisements, 1939, and undated

scopecontent.p: Primarily publicity material, including the publications News about Epic Records, Dateline Epic Classics, and Dateline Epic Pops.

arrangement.p: Arranged by publication title and chronologically within each publication.

did.unittitle: Series 10. RCA Victor Records, 1941-1954, and undated

scopecontent.p: The series includes publicity material and press department releases for RCA Victor Records, including individual series publications entitled News about RCA Victor Records, News Information, and Victor Record Bulletin.

unittitle.title: Announcing New Victor Red Seal Records

did.physloc: RPA 00391 (box 39); RPC 00013 (box OSC 1); RPE 00003 (box OSE 1); and RPM 00011 (map case)

scopecontent.p: Series includes publicity serial entitled Discos RCA Victor. Oversize material consists of accompanying promotional posters for individual record releases.

did.unittitle: Los Ultimos Exitos en Discos RCA Victor, 1950-1953
Series 12. Independent Record Labels, 1937-1957, 1973, and undated

scopecontent.p: Series 12 consists of promotional material from mail order record clubs such as American Recording Society, Concert Hall Society, Music Treasures of the World, and Disc of the Month; independent record labels such as Asch Records; overseas labels such as Columbia Graphophone Company; general record industry releases such as Vanguard News; market research material from Muzak Corporation and Copyright Office of Research, Inc.; and record retailers such as Steinway & Sons Record Shop and Gramophone Shop, Inc.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged by company name.

did.unittitle: The Boston University Anthology of Recorded Music, 1957
Concert Hall Society, Inc., 1946, and undated
Music Treasures of the World, 1957, and undated
Phonograph equipment ads from various companies, 1940s
Miscellaneous independent record label ephemera, 1939-1953, and undated
Casa Bautista de Publicaciones, Catalogo Especial, 1973
Miscellaneous record industry press and media materials, 1948-1953, and undated
Miscellaneous mail order record club fliers, 1940, 1947, and undated

scopecontent.p: This series consists of press releases from the American Broadcasting Company (ABC) and scripts from various radio programs, such as Music of the Jazz Bands, Music of the Theatre, Outpost Concert Series, and Radio Symphonies of America.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to program name.

did.unittitle: Press releases for American Broadcasting Company (ABC) "serious music" radio and television programs, 1948-1949
Music of the Jazz Bands continuity

did.unittitle: Series 14. Concert and Festival Programs and Announcements, 1944-1956

scopecontent.p: Consists of announcements, fliers, and releases about concerts and festivals.
